title: I Don't Understand Cassiopeia's Visual Design
body:
For starters, she's supposedly the sister of Katarina, yet they look nothing at all alike. While, yes, as a redhead, Katarina would most likely have fairer skin than Cassiopeia, that doesn't explain why Cass has one of the best tans in the game. Did she stay in Shurima for a weeks after getting cursed for that sweet complexion? Which brings me to my second point.  

While she was getting that oh so perfect tan, because you know, beauty goals, did she decide to immerse herself in Shuriman culture? That would explain all the gold she's wearing, and that headdress. She's supposed to be a Noxian champion, and currently in Universe, is back in Noxus, but you wouldn't know that unless you read her lore.  

Thirdly, wasn't she cursed, and had her beauty taken away or something? Part of her character is the loss of her beauty, yet she looks better than half the people I know. All that happened was she got a tail, slit pupils, and decided to start wearing green eye liner. Instead of having her wear claw jewelry, give her actual claws like in her Siren skin. Give her a forked tongue, or hair that's been withered or something. You don't have to make her look like Freddy Krueger, but at least something so she isn't just "girl with a snake tail".

replies.body:
I hate the "she's not ugly" argument.  Nowhere in the new lore does it suggest the curse was a curse of ugliness. And even if it was, it literally transformed her into a half-snake. Like, unless you're into some weird stuff, that's definitely not very beautiful.

Her design is fine.

> [{quoted}](name=Speak or Die,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Blsvmd7F,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-11T04:11:39.682+0000)
>
> Like, unless you're into some weird stuff, that's definitely not very beautiful.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/epicrapbattlesofhistory/images/4/4a/Mr-Bean-Meme.jpg

I'm not arguing to make her ugly, but to add more monstrous features, to help get the point across that she was cursed. In a Universe where we have beings like Nami, who's literally a fish, and other Vastaya, I'm pretty sure by most standards, Cassiopeia is still pretty okay looking. Not to mention with ghost, undead, spirits, and several other otherworldly entities walking around, Cassiopeia is fairly normal. 

 Also, the loss of her beauty has always been a part of her lore, "youngest daughter of one of Noxus's most influential families, she was once a beautiful and cunning temptress".  That's taken directly from her bio, notice how it says "once beautiful" implying that she is no longer beautiful. Even in her short story, there's a moment where she laments over the supposed loss of her beauty, when all that happened was she got a snake tail.

Having a snake tail bottom half would make anyone ugly to the majority of human beings. But I agree in general with your post that her visual design doesn't quite match her modern lore or faction. She's just one of those old-ish champions. If they made her today she would undoubtedly look different.

The majority of people (from what I've seen) *have not* agreed upon Cassiopeia's transformation being linked to Naganeka somehow preserving her own soul through her venom.

Yes, out of the 5 people that even bothered to hit the up or down arrow, 4 of them pressed the down arrow. That, however, is not a large enough sample size to deduce anything.

From the observable evidence, it can easily be deduced that the statue is of Naganeka. Just because people don't like or disagree with the observable evidence does not make the conclusion invalid. Consensus does not make something right or wrong. 

Here are the facts:

A woman was crushed by a statue of a snake Darkin.
That statue spilled poison on her and turned her into a snake.
She gained the power to spit poison and petrify anything she screams at.
A deified snake Darkin could also produce poison and rarely ever spoke, for some currently unexplained reason.
Several Ascended, including Darkin, have had statues made of them.
Souls can be preserved in both blood{{champion:8}} and bone{{champion:82}}, through bloodmagic and necromancy respectively.

Conclusion A: The statue was of Nageneka, and through some form of magic, probably bloodmagic, Cass gained the powers of Naganeka.

Conclusion B: It was a trap set to turn anyone who would rob Azir's tomb into an Ascended or Baccai.

Conclusion C: It was cursed to turn the grave robber into a social outcast, stealing their beauty, and turning them into a monster, because snakes in Shuriman culture could possibly have been bad, despite the fact that Naganeka was a snake and she was worshiped in Shuriman culture. 

Conclusion D: Due to the trap being so close to the Sun Disk for so long in a confined space, the poison, instead of killing the grave robber, caused them to partially Ascend, turning them into a Baccai.

> If Vlad killed Rhaast and then had his soul bound to the scythe, what is stopping Ta'anari from getting his soul bound to the crossblade after he died?

There's a key difference here.

Rhaast was never turned back into a human, meaning he's still very much a Darkin.

Ta'anari was, meaning he's no longer a Darkin.

>  
> But his soul is bound to his bones, every one of his bones, and they were all separated and are being guarded by his loyal lichs. 

His soul isn't "bound" to his bones, because that would mean the soul is within the bones at all times, which it isn't because the soul is within his armor when he's animating it.

It's more appropriate to call his bones an anchor for his soul when it leaves his armor.

This is the reviving process:

1. Mordekaiser dies on the battlefield.

2. His soul leaves his armor and is anchored back to his complete skeleton.

3. His liches retrieve his armor, bring it back to the skeleton, and transfers Mordekaiser's soul from the bones over to his armor.

When his skull was stolen, the "anchor" was incomplete, and thus Mordekaiser's soul couldn't be anchored back to his skeleton.

But when his skull was reunited with the rest of the skeleton, the "anchor" was complete and therefore his soul was anchored to the skeleton and his liches could then transfer it from the skeleton over to the armor.

We've seen no other Darkin that's capable of this.
